body_html:
It's not perfect, I agree with you, @j-wilson .
However, note that tf.cast([16, 2], dtype) is a tensor, while [tf.cast(16, 'int64'), tf.cast(2, 'int64')] is a list of tensors. In fact, tf.shape expects only a tensor for shape.
body_text:
It's not perfect, I agree with you, @j-wilson .
However, note that tf.cast([16, 2], dtype) is a tensor, while [tf.cast(16, 'int64'), tf.cast(2, 'int64')] is a list of tensors. In fact, tf.shape expects only a tensor for shape.
body:
It's not perfect, I agree with you, @j-wilson .
However, note that `tf.cast([16, 2], dtype)` is a tensor, while `[tf.cast(16, 'int64'), tf.cast(2, 'int64')]` is a list of tensors. In fact, `tf.shape` expects only a tensor for `shape`.
